bill.title: Firearms Disqualification; Mental Illness; Police
bill.description: Requires firearms owners who have been disqualified from owning a firearm and ammunition due to a diagnosis of significant behavioral, emotional, or mental disorder, or due to emergency or involuntary hospitalization to a psychiatric facility, to immediately surrender their firearms and ammunition to the Chief of Police. Allows the Chief of Police to seize firearms and ammunition if a disqualified individual fails to surrender the firearms and ammunition after receiving written notice of the disqualification. (HB2632 CD1)

referrals.name: Public Safety, Intergovernmental and Military Affairs

history.action: Introduced and Passed First Reading
Referred to HLT, JUD, referral sheet 5
Bill scheduled to be heard by HLT on Wednesday, 02-10-16 10:00AM in House conference room 329.
The committee(s) on HLT recommend(s) that the measure be deferred until 02-12-16 11:30AM.
Bill scheduled for decision making on Friday, 02-12-16 11:30AM in conference room 329.

The committees on HLT recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 8 Ayes: Representative(s) Belatti, Creagan, Hashem, Kobayashi; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Jordan, Morikawa, Oshiro, Fukumoto Chang; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Tupola.
Reported from HLT (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 389-16) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JUD.

Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with Representative(s) DeCoite, Har, Jordan, Matsumoto, Oshiro, Pouha, San Buenaventura, Tupola, Ward voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) McDermott voting no (1) and none excused (0).
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Tuesday, 02-23-16 2:00PM in House conference room 325.
Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 12 Ayes: Representative(s) Rhoads, San Buenaventura, Belatti, Brower, Creagan, Hashem, C. Lee, Morikawa, Nakashima, Takayama, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Kawakami; 1 Noes: Representative(s) McDermott; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Woodson.
Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1007-16) as amended in HD 2, recommending passage on Third Reading.
Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday, 03-08-16.

Passed Third Reading as amended in HD 2 with Representative(s) Aquino, Creagan, Cullen, DeCoite, Evans, Har, Jordan, Kawakami, Lowen, Matsumoto, Pouha, Thielen, Tsuji, Ward, Yamane voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Choy, Ito, Kong, McDermott, Oshiro, Say, Tokioka, Tupola voting no (8) and none excused (0). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 341).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to PSM, JDL.
The committee(s) on PSM has scheduled a public hearing on 03-17-16 1:45PM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on PSM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in PSM were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Nishihara, Espero, Baker; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Inouye.
Reported from PSM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2948) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to JDL.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDL.
The committee(s) on JDL will hold a public decision making on 03-30-16 9:30AM in conference room 016.

The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDL were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Keith-Agaran, Shimabukuro, Kim, L. Thielen; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Gabbard ; 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) K.Kahele.
Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3488) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 2).
48 Hrs. Notice 04-12-16.

Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 2). Ayes, 23; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Chun Oakland, Gabbard, Ihara, K.Kahele, Wakai . Noes, 1 (Senator(s) Harimoto). Excused, 1 (Senator(s) Slom). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 631) in amended form (SD 2).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 609).
Senate Conferees Appointed: Nishihara Chair; Keith-Agaran Co-Chair; Espero.
House Conferees Appointed: Belatti, Rhoads Co-Chairs; C. Lee, Fukumoto Chang.
Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 652).
Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 611).
House conferee(s) replaced: Representative(s) Ward replaced Representative(s) Fukumoto Chang as conferee(s).
Conference committee meeting scheduled for 04-21-16 8:30AM in conference room 312.
Received notice of change in conferees (Hse. Com. No. 620).
Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Friday 04-22-16 9:30AM in conference room 312.
Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Tuesday 04-26-16 9:00AM in conference room 312.

The Conference Committee recommends that the measure be Passed, with Amendments. The votes were as follows: 3 Ayes: Representative(s) Belatti, Rhoads, C. Lee; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Ward.

The Conference committee recommends that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes of the Senate Conference Managers were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Nishihara, Keith-Agaran, Espero; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from Conference Committee (Conf Com. Rep. No. 69-16) as amended in (CD 1).
Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday, 05-03-16.
Reported from Conference Committee as amended CD 1 (Conf. Com. Rep. No. 69-16).
48 Hrs. Notice (as amended CD 1) 05-03-16.
Passed Final Reading, as amended (CD 1). 22 Aye(s); Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Gabbard, Riviere, Ruderman . 2 No(es): Senator(s) Harimoto, Slom. 1 Excused: Senator(s) Shimabukuro.

Passed Final Reading as amended in CD 1 with Representative(s) Ward voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Aquino, Choy, Creagan, Cullen, DeCoite, Har, Ito, Jordan, Kong, McDermott, McKelvey, Oshiro, Say, Tokioka, Tupola, Yamane voting no (16) and none excused (0).
Received notice of Final Reading (Sen. Com. No. 715).
Received notice of passage on Final Reading in House (Hse. Com. No. 685).
Transmitted to Governor.
